After tying the knot in 2003, the couple tried to keep their romantic relationship out of the spotlight, but their onscreen partnership was just getting started. In 2004, the Yes Please author made her first guest appearance on Arrested Development as Bride of G.O.B., the wife of Arnettâs character, G.O.B. Bluth.

Three years later, the twosome starred on the big screen as the villains in Blades of Glory. Poehler played Fairchild Van Waldenberg, while Arnett played her brother and skating partner, Stranz Van Waldenberg.

âItâs way more fun to be evil,â the Baby Mama actress told Collider of the role in March 2007. âWhat was fun about our stuff was that we had to look like from the outside that we were all sweet, but inside we were rotten to the core. That was really fun to play.â

In June 2010, the BoJack Horseman alum teamed up with his Arrested Development castmate Jason Bateman to present his then-wife with a Webby Award. Even then, he couldnât resist turning the event into an opportunity for comedy, doing a bit where the Ozark star âmistakenlyâ read Arnettâs lines instead of his own.

âIf it were up to me, Jason, I would give her the Webby for the best wife,â Bateman joked. âThe possibilities for this woman are seemingly endless,â Arnett said before realizing he was reading Batemanâs lines. âIn fact, some say if it wasnât for some dead weight that sheâs been lugging around, who knows where sheâd be â¦ what the fâk is this?â
